alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains West; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:03AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Hot Springs, Big Horn, western Washakie and northeastern Park Counties through 145 AM MDT... At 103 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Frannie to 7 miles southwest of Thermopolis. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Thermopolis and Hot Springs State Park around 115 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Crooked Creek Natural Area, Bighorn Lake and Horseshoe Bend. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains West; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
